alert.note: Alert for Portage (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:31PM CDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River below Stevens Point affecting Portage County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wisconsin River below Stevens Point. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1076.0 feet, There is widespread flooding of wooded lowland areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:10 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 1077.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:10 PM CDT Wednesday was 1077.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 1076.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1077.4 feet on 04/12/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
